topics.body:
I'm very satisfied with myself. Nothing new I know, but this time it is slightly more petty than usual.

I managed to kill a Centaur and Super Mutant Master (armed with a minigun) while only level 6 with Project Nevada.

Sure it took 5 tries, at least, and I almost died from radiation afterwards and had to limp to the nearest town to sell stuff afterwards, but it was still fun and triumphant.

I say this not to simply bump the thread but also to segue into a completely unrelated topic: tiger moms.

Do they work? Well, to use the Finns as an example, I would say no more so than any involved parent.
Without any statistics (aside from the Finns having the best students/schools) it strikes me as the same conceit behind the Prussian education system: if we force it in the child's head, they will magically be smarter.
Yes that is a strawman, but I'm being a little fast and loose.
Thoughts?
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
You know I realized something kind of fucked up:
How is it that luddites have gained a stranglehold on politics and science?

Most people here are familiar with the idea behind luddites or at least know what it is.  They were supposed to have gone extinct in the 1800's, but think about it for a second; how often do you hear about some brand new technological advancement and the response by politics or people is automatically "*BAN ALL OF IT!*" with large groups of people trying to nuke any new technological or scientific advancement back to the stone age?

How is it that a long dead anti-technology movement has seeped so far into society that we have entire political parties that try to to suffocate any research into scientific advancement and try to snuff out departments towards bettering our understanding of the universe.  I mean my god people have tried to shit can pbs for being a educational channel.  We have politicians who constantly try to get rid of education.  We have politicians who constantly try to get rid of nasa.  We have politicians who constantly try to ban new advances in technology or try to suffocate it to death.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532219806368722be9110000#post_532219806368722be9110000
Who says this?
I know people don't like Stem Cell, Genetic research or Nuclear research but I did not know it stretched so far
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53221fe06368720f8c2f0000#post_53221fe06368720f8c2f0000
Congress.

Just look at whenever they're talking about global warming, evolution, increasing funding for education, increasing funding for nasa and so forth.

It took for someone at a nasa hearing to be asked, "Well if a asteroid is coming towards earth what can we do?" and the nasa official going, "pray" for them consider increasing fund- oh wait they didn't anyhow.  You heard that right; not even the threat of the complete extinction of mankind is more important than furthering luddite ideology.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
